headline: Taxes Irs Recovers 13 Million Unpaid Taxes Wealthy Americans
summary: Since late 2023, the IRS has recovered $1.3 billion in unpaid taxes from high-income Americans,accordingto the Treasury Department.The Details:The money was collected due to new initiatives launched by the IRS following increased funding from theInflation Reduction Actpassed in 2022. In February 2024, the IRS began pursuing 125,000 “high-income, high-wealth taxpayers” who had not filed taxes since 2017. Six months later, around 21,000 of those taxpayers had filed their taxes, amounting to $172 million in recovered funds.For Context:In a 2019 speech, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the top one percent of wealthy Americans owed more than one-fifth of all unpaid taxes.How the Media Covered It:Media across the spectrum focused on the improvements made to the IRS.The Washington Times (Lean Right bias)alsoincludedRepublican concerns that President Joe Biden "supercharged" the IRS.
